meanings.sent1: The profusive waterfall cascaded down the rocks.
meanings.sent2: The garden was filled with profusive flowers of all colors.
meanings.sent3: The profusive display of fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent4: Her profusive generosity knew no bounds.
meanings.sent5: The profusive rain soaked everything in its path.

meanings.definition: Characterized by unrestrained or excessive emotion
meanings.sent1: She gave a profusive speech at the award ceremony.
meanings.sent2: His profusive tears showed his deep sorrow.
meanings.sent3: The profusive laughter echoed through the room.
meanings.sent4: Their profusive hugs conveyed their joy at the reunion.
meanings.sent5: The profusive apologies were heartfelt and sincere.

meanings.sent1: The profusive harvest filled the barn to the brim.
meanings.sent2: The profusive buffet offered a wide variety of dishes.
meanings.sent3: The profusive praise from the audience boosted his confidence.
meanings.sent4: Her profusive energy was contagious to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The profusive sunlight bathed the meadow in warmth.
